feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [magento/core] Magento stored cross-site scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 1.14.4.5 and earlier, and 1.9.4.5 and earlier have a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to sensitive information disclosure. A patch SUPEE-11346 is available at Magento Open Source Download Page > Release Archive Tab > Magento Open Source Patches - 1.x Section

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9665
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-41.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xc4p-j89c-p7x5

entry.title: [magento/core] Magento php object injection vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 1.14.4.5 and earlier, and 1.9.4.5 and earlier have a php object injection vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution. A patch SUPEE-11346 is available at Magento Open Source Download Page > Release Archive Tab > Magento Open Source Patches - 1.x Section

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9664
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-41.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-337c-3rch-q35j

entry.title: [magento/core] Magento business logic error vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.4 and earlier, 2.2.11 and earlier (see note), 1.14.4.4 and earlier, and 1.9.4.4 and earlier have a business logic error vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to privilege escalation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9630
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-22.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5j4w-v87m-8r65

entry.title: [magento/core] Magento security mitigation bypass vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.4 and earlier, 2.2.11 and earlier (see note), 1.14.4.4 and earlier, and 1.9.4.4 and earlier have a security mitigation bypass vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9631
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-22.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gffx-9f36-r8wp

entry.title: [magento/core] Magento defense-in-depth security mitigation vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.4 and earlier, 2.2.11 and earlier (see note), 1.14.4.4 and earlier, and 1.9.4.4 and earlier have a defense-in-depth security mitigation vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to admin panel.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9591
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-22.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w7rh-9w5v-rwqj

entry.title: [magento/core] Magento authorization bypass vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.4 and earlier, 2.2.11 and earlier (see note), 1.14.4.4 and earlier, and 1.9.4.4 and earlier have an authorization bypass vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to potentially unauthorized product discounts.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9587
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-22.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8wm7-h2qh-ff4c

entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.4 and earlier, 2.2.11 and earlier (see note), 1.14.4.4 and earlier, and 1.9.4.4 and earlier have a command injection vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution.
